Description: Light blue-greenish base fragment of a small glass flask, blown. Slightly kicked-up base.
Production place: Made in: Egypt (raw glass originally from Levantine area?)
Curator's comments: Chemical analysis (by eletron probe micro-analysis (EPMA)) showed that this glass has slightly elevated levels of antimony and manganese and is compositionally close to the so-called Roman blue/green glass, a relatively uncommon raw glass group in Roman Egypt where antimony-decoloured glass was prevalent. The raw glass itself might thus have been an import from the Levantine area. However, this does not exclude that the vessel was worked in Naukratis.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (FE.08)
